meanings.definition: The state or quality of being overmature.
meanings.sent1: The overmaturities of the fruit made it too soft to eat.
meanings.sent2: The farmer had to discard the overmaturities of the vegetables as they were no longer fresh.
meanings.sent3: The overmaturities of the cheese made it taste like a strong, stinky sock.
meanings.sent4: Her overmaturities in decision-making led to her being overly cautious in every situation.
meanings.sent5: The overmaturities of the wine gave it a rich and complex flavor.

meanings.definition: The condition of having reached an excessive level of maturity.
meanings.sent1: The overmaturities of the student were evident in his wise and thoughtful responses.
meanings.sent2: The overmaturities of the fruit caused it to be too ripe for consumption.
meanings.sent3: The overmaturities of the joke made it seem like it belonged in a dad joke book.
meanings.sent4: Her overmaturities in handling difficult situations made her stand out among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The overmaturities of the tree made it stand tall and strong in the forest.
